title.narrative: F.a: Strengthening the West African Health Sector Unions

description.narrative: The project strengthens the West African health sector trade union network?s knowledge and awareness of regional organisations? modes of operation and decision making policies, so that trade unions can influence the decision-making in them.For public secto r workers, trade union activity and advocacy in West African countries is very difficult. The rights of public sector workers to organise have been severely restricted and the sector's trade unions are not officially recognised by the central government as negotiating partners. In addition, trade union members and union leaders are threatened and pressured to give up advocacy work and trade union activities. The project strengthens the knowledge of West African trade unions? officers, education officers and presidents on decision-making processes in multilateral institutions. As a result, they will be able to influence health care and social policies in the region. In the first phase of the project national plans of action are prepared. The plans of action w ill direct the lobbying to essential ministries and country representatives of multilateral institutions. The beneficiaries of the project are the West African health sector workers, most of whom are women, whose position in the labour market system improv es as a result of the more worker friendly legislation.The project is implemented by public sector global union federation Public Services International (PSI).
